Legal_Issue: Admissibility of new evidence in judicial review
Application_Facts: Applicant sought to introduce a doctor's letter after the removal order decision
Court_Ruling: New evidence was excluded; standard deadlines for completing the record reinstated
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over admitting new medical evidence in judicial review of removal order denial
Legal_Standard: Judicial review examines decisions based on evidence available at the time
Procedural_Issue: Prothonotary initially allowed evidence; Federal Court overturned on appeal
Review_Standard: Judicial review focuses on legality of original decision
Application_Basis: Request to admit new evidence post-decision
Evidence_Assessed: Doctor's letter deemed irrelevant to original decision
Governing_Rule: Judicial review does not allow new facts unless related to procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: New evidence not part of original record
Outcome: New evidence excluded; appeal granted on procedural grounds
Cause_Description: Dispute over admitting new medical evidence in a judicial review of a removal order denial
Evidence_Handling: Excluded new evidence introduced after decision
Evidence_Issues: Introduction of post-decision evidence in judicial review
Evidence_Assessment: Court found evidence irrelevant to original decision
Decision_Rationale: Judicial review limited to examining legality based on record at time of decision
Evidentiary_Issues: Attempt to introduce new evidence after decision
Legal_Standard_Applied: Judicial review confined to evidence before decision-maker at time of decision
